stem: The nurse in a gastroenterology clinic is reviewing follow-up plans for four clients. Based on the documentation in the Pathology & Procedure Summary, match each client with their correct screening frequency.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
Patient A: 45-year-old male. Had his first routine colonoscopy yesterday. Results were completely normal.
Patient B: 52-year-old female. Had a colonoscopy with removal of three adenomatous polyps.
Patient C: 50-year-old male. Positive Cologuard (FIT-DNA) test last week.
Patient D: 30-year-old female. Diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis (UC) 10 years ago.

tabs.title: Pathology & Procedure Summary
tabs.content:
PatientFindingClinical Status
AClean Colon; No polypsAverage Risk
BMultiple AdenomasIncreased Risk
CPositive Stool DNARequires Visual Screen (Diagnostic)
DActive Colitis; Friable tissueHigh Risk for dysplasia

tabs.title: Family History
tabs.content: Patient A: No history. Patient B: Sister has polyps. Patient D: First-degree relative with Colon Cancer.

rows.text: Average risk; Repeat colonoscopy in 10 years
Increased risk (Polyps found); Repeat colonoscopy in 3–5 years
Symptomatic/Positive stool DNA; Repeat (Visual) colonoscopy ASAP
High risk (IBD history); Repeat colonoscopy every 1–2 years

rationale.correct: For average-risk adults (c1) with a normal colonoscopy, the repeat is every 10 years (r1). Enhanced surveillance (c2) is for those with polyps (r2) or high-risk conditions like IBD (r4). A diagnostic protocol (c3) is triggered by symptoms or positive non-invasive tests (r3) to confirm the presence of cancer visually.
clinicalPearls: 45 is the new 50 for colonoscopy start.
A stool test (Cologuard) is a SCREENING tool; if it is positive, the patient MUST have a COLONOSCOPY (Diagnostic) to find out why.
Patients with Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's disease have a significantly higher risk of cancer and need yearly or bi-yearly screens.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking that a stool test replaces the need for a colonoscopy forever.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the stool test is positive, it is NOT 'just data'; it is an emergency diagnostic trigger.

mnemonic.title: Colon 45
mnemonic.expansion: At age 45, check the inside (Colonoscopy) to stay alive.
